Articles.Content:
I am pretty sure that will be a must. Even my system gets cranky with all the other mods I have on top of this.

i have a suggestion why not do a low res one for people with memory problems

I am pretty sure that will be a must. Even my system gets cranky with all the other mods I have on top of this.

thats strange, I have over 50 mods installed including this one and KW, kethane, interstellar, planet factory and ksp still runs smoother than ever.

i have a suggestion why not do a low res one for people with memory problems

That would be good; my computer can only *just* run this, and let's just say minmus sends it into a tantrum...
this is a bit OT but... Who's version of "where did you sleep last night" is that?
Well, those modular clouds are lagging to me (i have a not-so-good laptop integrated video card), the stock version runs at 60fps so its clearly not processors fault...

I finalized the new main Kerbin cloud layer texture as well as some high altitude clouds finally. Was one hell of a challenge, but I feel really good about them as a solid alternative to the default EVE clouds. A lot more opportunities for clear sunny days and less cloudy poles
Got this working. Now you can set up asteroid bases in Jool's rings!
WOW. Its one thing to create "rings" but another to include real rocks in them.
are the rings compatible with custom asteroids?

are the rings compatible with custom asteroids?

That's what I'm using to get the asteroids to work in the first place So yes.

Got this working. Now you can set up asteroid bases in Jool's rings!

http://i.imgur.com/ROj5Qsi.png?1

OMG How awesome is this. I love you sonic (no homo )

Got this working. Now you can set up asteroid bases in Jool's rings!

http://i.imgur.com/ROj5Qsi.png?1

Seriously though, I'm starting to wonder how much you are able to cram into this update!

Made more specific asteroids.

C Ring Ast. - Slowest spawn rate and are found in the lowest ring. They have the least inclination and eccentricity.

B Ring Ast. - Medium spawn rate and are found in the middle rings. They have a fair amount of inclination and a fair amount of eccentricity.

A Ring Ast. - Fast spawn rate and are found in the farthest rings. They have a large amount of inclination and a large amount of eccentricity.

Edited May 22, 2014 by Thesonicgalaxy

Made more specific asteroids.

C Ring Ast. - Slowest spawn rate and are found in the lowest ring. They have the least inclination and eccentricity.

B Ring Ast. - Medium spawn rate and are found in the middle rings. They have a fair amount of inclination and a fair amount of eccentricity.

A Ring Ast. - Fast spawn rate and are found in the farthest rings. They have a large amount of inclination and a large amount of eccentricity.

http://i.imgur.com/VbEWke9.png?1

Nicely done my friend! This update just gets crazier haha.

that's what i'm using to get the asteroids to work in the first place so yes.

yessssss!!!!!!
So are we getting the cosmetic rings along with the asteroid rings? that would be awesome...

So are we getting the cosmetic rings along with the asteroid rings? that would be awesome...

Yes you guys are.

Edited May 22, 2014 by Thesonicgalaxy

Hey Sonic, I've got a couple of questions.

1. Jool's rings; can I change the colour of them if I wanted?

2. Your Large Magellanic Cloud skybox, how did you get it all to connect? I've been trying and I'm having no luck matching them up right. I know Space Engine doesn't quite match KSP right off the bat, but even with what seem like appropriate changes, I'm getting mismatches.

I know 2 is slightly off-topic, but I'm getting slightly annoyed by the whole thing now

As for the asteroids in the rings... Nice

Hey Sonic, I've got a couple of questions.

1. Jool's rings; can I change the colour of them if I wanted?

2. Your Large Magellanic Cloud skybox, how did you get it all to connect? I've been trying and I'm having no luck matching them up right. I know Space Engine doesn't quite match KSP right off the bat, but even with what seem like appropriate changes, I'm getting mismatches.

I know 2 is slightly off-topic, but I'm getting slightly annoyed by the whole thing now

As for the asteroids in the rings... Nice

Mason, switch positive and negative x and z.

Ex:

GalaxyTex_PositiveX = GalaxyTex_NegativeX

GalaxyTex_PositiveZ = GalaxyTex_NegativeZ etc etc..

Hey Sonic, I've got a couple of questions.

1. Jool's rings; can I change the colour of them if I wanted?

2. Your Large Magellanic Cloud skybox, how did you get it all to connect? I've been trying and I'm having no luck matching them up right. I know Space Engine doesn't quite match KSP right off the bat, but even with what seem like appropriate changes, I'm getting mismatches.

I know 2 is slightly off-topic, but I'm getting slightly annoyed by the whole thing now

As for the asteroids in the rings... Nice

1. Of course you could.

2.Renamed the files accordingly, I put the skybox in, looked around, saw what rotations were required, and then it all matched up

Edited May 22, 2014 by Thesonicgalaxy
